description: This dataset shows projections of aragonite saturation in the world’s oceans from 2006-2099. The aragonite saturation state (Ωarag) is commonly used to track ocean acidification because it is a measure of carbonate ion concentration, which indicates the availability of the calcium carbonate that is widely used by marine calcifiers, from lobsters to clams to starfish.
title: Projected Ocean Acidification
citation: van Hooidonk R, Maynard J, Manzello D, Planes S (2014) Opposite latitudinal gradients in projected ocean acidification and bleaching impacts on coral reefs.
